secret_rule: The item can be brought to the picnic only if its name is a single-word noun that starts with the letter 'P'.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "Pineapple" and "Pillow".
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring a "Pumpkin" to the game?
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring a "Peacock" to the game?

Based on the examples and the responses from the game master, the rule seems to be that you can bring an item to the game if its name starts with the letter "P" and ends with the letter "n". Therefore, items like "Pineapple" and "Pillow" fit the pattern because they start with "P" and end with "e" or "w", respectively. "Pumpkin" fits this rule as it starts with "P" and ends with "n", which was allowed. "Peacock", however, does not end with "n", so it was not allowed.

Therefore, my best guess for the rule is: You can bring items to the game that start with "P" and end with "n".
